The first official event of the GOLEM project will be about discussing ontologies for narrative and fiction.

Date: 3-4 July 2023

Time: 09:00 – 17:00 CET

Language: English


**Program**

**3 July**	

9:00-9:45	Janna Hastings, "How can fiction change the world? Towards an ontology of literary characters and their interactions" [(slides)](slides/Hastings_literary_characters_compressed.pdf)

9:45-10:30	Paul Sheridan, "Toward creating a collection of literary themes for use in supervised learning applications" [(slides)](slides/Sheridan_theme_ontology-compressed.pdf)

15 min break	

10:45-11:30	Christof Schöch and Maria Hinzmann, "Towards an ontology for literary history: issues of complexity and scale when constructing the MiMoTextBase" [(slides)](slides/Schoech_Hinzmann_MiMoText.pdf)

11:30-12:15	Ingo Börner, "Modeling Drama Corpora in CIDOC-CRM" [(slides)](slides/Boerner_Drama_Corpora_CIDOC_compressed.pdf)

lunch	

13:30-14:15	Valentina Pasqual, "An ontology for compositional structures, plot concepts and character roles. Case study on the 'macchina combinatoria' in 'Il castello dei destini incrociati' by Italo Calvino" [(slides)](slides/Pasqual_ODI.pdf)

14:15-15:00	Marco Stranisci, "The World Literature Knowledge Graph: a resource for studying the underrepresentation of non-Western people" [(slides)](slides/Stranisci_WL-KG.pdf)

15 min break	

15:15-16:00	Ines Blin, "Leveraging structured representations for narratives" [(slides)](slides/Blin_structured_narrative_compressed.pdf)

16-16:45	Magnus Pfeffer and Zoltán Kacsuk, "Creating a unified ontology for the Japanese Visual Media Graph" [(slides)](slides/Pfeffer_Kacsuk_JVMG.pdf)

	
**4 July**

09:00-9:45	Federico Pianzola and Xiaoyan Yang, "First steps of the GOLEM ontology for narrative and fiction" [(slides)](slides/Pianzola-Yang_GOLEM_ontology_compressed.pdf)

09:45-10:30	Luca Scotti, "Alignment and harmonisation: Mapping ontologies for narrative and fiction" [(slides)](slides/Scotti_alignment.pdf)

15 min break	

10:45-12:00	hands-on session: open issues in the modelling of narrative and fiction
